CatDescriptText: Related image and portion of article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1964, pg. 1, reads: "Driver, 61, Lives After Road in Front Disappears - Seemingly by some miracle, 61-year-old James P. Thurman of 7504 Upland St. is alive after the road "disappeared" under him at the top of the Morgan St. hill (arrow) last Thursday shortly before 8 P.M. Actually, the road did not disappear, because the section of what formerly was a thoroughfare had been removed by the Graziano Construction Co., in execution of a building contract with the University of Pittsburgh.  And where Morgan St. left the Carillo St. intersection and leveled off for a short plateau-like passage to Allequippa St., there were no barriers to warn motorists that the street was no longer there, police said...-Harris Photos"
TitMainTitle: 1956 Roadmaster Riviera car driven by James P. Thurman, crashed over an embankment with two sawhorses, corner of Carrillo Street and Morgan Street, Hill District, another version
CatSubject_tab: Morgan Street (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Hill District (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Carillo Street (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Automobiles--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
